data.title: Sapphire Room Live Music and Events Calendar
data.meta_description: Don't miss out on live events in the Sapphire Room! View the show calendar and order your tickets today. The Sapphire Room concert venue, restaurant and bar offers table side service with a full small plates and dinner menu, craft cocktails, and regular performances by local and touring musicians.
data.meta_site_name: The Sapphire Room at the Riverside Hotel
data.text:
BALLROOM EVENT - The Riverside Hotel's Watermelon Crawl

Get ready to swing and sway the night away at The Watermelon Crawl country swing dancing event! Held in the Riverside Hotel's ballroom, Sweet Briar band will keep the dance floor rocking with toe-tapping country melodies. Beginners & experts alike can dive into the fun with swing dancing lessons from 6:15 to 7:15, led by the talented SWAY with Sydney—included in the ticket price. Dust off your dancing shoes, grab your partner, and get ready to twirl and whirl the night away with us!

Sunday, August 25th, 2024 - Doors at 5:45pm, lessons from 6:15-7:15pm, music from 7:30pm - 10:00pm

General Admission: $20 +tax & fees(21+)

View Event →

Bad Moon Riders- CCR Tribute

Bad Moon Riders proudly present a Salute to the Music and Hit Songs of Creedence Clearwater Revival.

This is a Professional hard driving show from start to finish that will transport you back to the golden era of rock. Creedence’s songs – including, “Fortunate Son”, “Proud Mary”, “Born On The Bayou”, “Bad Moon Risin’, endure as timeless rock and roll classics that defined the spirit and sound of North American music as authentically as any group ever has.

Bad Moon Riders take great pleasure in faithfully recreating the music of CCR just as you remember it, lived it, and loved it!

SOLD OUT

View Event →

Bad Moon Riders- CCR Tribute

Bad Moon Riders proudly present a Salute to the Music and Hit Songs of Creedence Clearwater Revival.

This is a Professional hard driving show from start to finish that will transport you back to the golden era of rock. Creedence’s songs – including, “Fortunate Son”, “Proud Mary”, “Born On The Bayou”, “Bad Moon Risin’, endure as timeless rock and roll classics that defined the spirit and sound of North American music as authentically as any group ever has.

Bad Moon Riders take great pleasure in faithfully recreating the music of CCR just as you remember it, lived it, and loved it!

SOLD OUT

View Event →

Rock Dee House Dueling Pianos

Rock Dee House Dueling Pianos is back for another exciting show. Two talented pianists will take your song requests, crack jokes, and play the tunes you love to sing along to on their baby grand pianos. It's a fun and interactive experience with lots of laughter and great music!

LOW TICKET ALERT

View Event →

Sixtiesmania

Sixtiesmania, a sixties tribute band, covers everything from the Beatles British invasion to the music of Woodstock and more! Sixtiesmania covers the Stones, Doors, Monkees, Beach Boys, Kinks, Free, Cream, and many others with spirit and energy.

SOLD OUT

View Event →

Idaho Songwriters Association Forum

Sit back and enjoy the show while you listen to local songwriters perform one original song, or step into the spotlight and share a song of your own! This monthly event celebrating 100% original music by local performers takes place on the last Tuesday of every month. The Sapphire Room features a full food and bar menu with table-side service during this event. FREE and open to the public. Seating is first come first served.

View Event →

Frim Fram 4

The Frim Fram 4, based in Boise, Idaho, specializes in the classic tunes of the 30's through the early 60's. Their original instrumentation reflected that of the Nat King Cole trio, relying on vocals, piano, stand up bass, and the exciting new sound of the electric guitar.

With special guest Andrew Nemr: Mentored by Gregory Hines, Andrew Nemr is an international tap dance artist. His work has been featured on the TED stage, off-Broadway, and on film. Described as “A masterly tapper” by the New York Times, Andrew is recorded on the Grammy nominated recording Itsbynne Reel by Dave Eggar, is the topic of the award-winning documentary short film Identity: The Andrew Nemr Story, and hosts the weekly podcast, Talking Notes.

SOLD OUT

View Event →

Stef & The Groove

Stef & The Groove returns for their fall debut at The Sapphire Room. The popular band is back with their trademark mix of R&B, Funk, Rock and Contemporary Blues. Stef & The Groove's show is one you won't want to miss.

LOW TICKET ALERT

View Event →

Jesse Roper Band

Based in Victoria, BC, Jesse Roper is a blues/Americana artist with a penchant for writing modern indie-infused blues music and delivering bombastic live performances buoyed by his virtuosic guitar playing. His innate and impressive musical talent has served him well, giving him the flexibility to play with soul icon Booker T. Jones, rock veteran Colin James, blues belter Beth Hart, and Canadian legend Burton Cummings. The stage is where Roper shines. It has been his home since overcoming crippling stage fright during his early twenties. Fear is a part of Roper’s past that barely seems real today - especially when you see the in-concert image of a six-string soldier, hair matted to his face, tearing up the stage, without a hint of second-guessing.

View Event →

Roll On- A Tribute to Alabama

We want you to experience the legendary music of Alabama live! Roll On loves sharing their timeless music with old and new fans. Roll On recreates Alabama's tight harmonies, infectious energy, and excellent musicianship. Dance to songs like Dixieland Delight, I’m in a Hurry (and Don’t Know Why), Song of the South, Mountain Music, and more!

View Event →

BALLROOM EVENT- The Riverside Hotel’s Harvest Ball

Celebrate fall at the Riverside Hotel's Harvest Ball, and dance the night away to the Jeff Crosby Band in the Riverside’s Grand Ballroom.

View Event →

John Clifton

Clifton is a veteran road dog whose travels have regularly crisscrossed the U.S. in addition to playing festivals as far away as France, Belgium, Poland, and New Zealand to the tune of 150 dates a year. John's mad harmonica skills have placed him on stages shared by James Cotton, John Mayall, Luther Tucker, Kim Wilson, and a host of other talented bluesmen. His harp chops landed him the job of featured harmonica player while touring and recording with Big Bill Morganfield on his 2016 release, "Bloodstains on the Wall."

Presented by the Boise Blues Society

View Event →

Hillfolk Noir

Grooving. Raucous. Genre-bending. And always a ton of fun.

Built on more than 15 years of tradition, today’s Hillfolk takes their acoustic guitar, double bass, and “anything you can find at a hardware store” sound and integrates driving drums and an electrified sound, kicking down limitations to create a vibe that goes beyond their Americana “junkerdash” roots. Want to call it bluegrass’s trouble-making cousin? Fine by us. A bit of string-band blues? Sure ‘nuff. A concoction of electrified rockin’ soulful folksy witchcraft mayhem? Now you’re talking, mama.

View Event →

Morgan James

Let’s start with the voice, an instrument through which she can communicate anything. A gift bestowed upon her that she has expertly trained, meticulously nurtured, and passionately galvanized into action by an urgency to make real music. Next, the stories, and she has them in spades. They are full of truth and beauty, heartache and thoughtfulness. They reveal colors we weren’t expecting to see. They make us close our eyes and relate. And finally, the soul – the emotional and intellectual energy through which these parts are fueled. That special something that prompted The Wall Street Journal to herald her as "the most promising young vocalist to come along so far this century."

That young vocalist is Morgan James. And Morgan James is a soul singer. One voice is all it takes. The right vocalist can make you fall in love at first listen, elicit tears, or bring you back to a different era altogether. A microphone and a stage remain the only necessities. That holds true for New York-based soul singer, songwriter, and Broadway actress Morgan James.

View Event →

Tim O'Brien with Jan Fabricius

Multi-Grammy award winner Tim O’Brien and his wife Jan Fabricius have performed together nationally and internationally either as a duo or as part of the Tim O’Brien Band since 2015. In a duet setting with a guitar, a mandolin, and their two voices, they bring an intimate and warm acoustic music roots repertoire that’s at once both original and traditional.

Tim’s songs have been covered by Kathy Mattea, Garth Brooks, and the Dixie Chicks, and his collaborators onstage and in the recording studio include Darrell Scott, Dirk Powell, Mark Knopfler, and Sturgill Simpson. Awarded Grammy’s in both the Folk and Bluegrass categories, he is a member ofboth the West Virginia and the Colorado Music Hall of Fame.

Jan’s music with O’Brien started informally around their home as he wrote or learned new songs, and she soon found herself singing and playing mandolin in the studio and onstage. O’Brien’s 2021 release “He Walked On”, and his upcoming release “Cup of Sugar” feature original songs cowritten by Tim and Jan

View Event →

Tree City Soul - Wag to the Music

Tree City Soul is a pop cover band based in Boise, ID, known for their eclectic blend of funk, soul, pop, R&B, and dance music. Comprised of veteran musicians, each member brings a wealth of touring experience from across the country, having mastered a variety of genres including rock, jazz, and blues.

Come out to support a great cause! Your ticket proceeds will be donated to Friends Furever Animal Rescue. There will also be a silent auction taking place at The Riverside Hotel the evening of the show.

View Event →

American Tradition

American Tradition - A classic country band playing music from the iconic greats such as the Hag, Cash, Waylon, Willie, Strait, Jackson, Charlie Daniels, and many more! American Tradition Band is comprised of skilled professional players that love to get the dance floor groovin with entertainment that will surely please!

View Event →

Rob Scheps and Core-tet Idaho

Presented by Surel’s Place.

World class tenor and soprano saxophonist Rob Scheps has a musical practice that is threefold: saxophonist, flutist, and composer. He's had a long award-winning career playing with the great artists such as Ray Charles, Buddy Rich, Aretha Franklin, Gil Evans, John Abercrombie, Eartha Kitt, Lew Soloff and hundreds more. He features mainly jazz, but also other genres such as classical, funk, soul, Broadway, and chamber music. He uses fresh creative approaches to rhythm, melody, meter, groove and timbre.

He is the current artist-in-residence at Surel's Place where he is working on a multi-movement original suite for jazz quintet comprised of pieces dedicated to some jazz icons who are his personal heroes. The piece is to be performed and recorded in NYC and Atlanta by his band, The Rob Scheps Core-tet.

View Event →

Neil Diamond The Tribute

Presented by Scorpion Entertainment

Long time Las Vegas performer and Legends in Concert alumni, Rob Garrett, is America’s #1 Neil Diamond tribute artist, and is unparalleled in his portrayal of the legendary performer.

From Vegas to Honolulu, to New York, to Berlin… Rob has come to be known as the ‘King of Diamonds’ as he is able to naturally capture the presence, passion, and energy of this iconic performer in all his youthful ‘jazz singer’ glory. Those who have witnessed Rob’s unparalleled performances will testify that YOU SIMPLY CAN’T GET ANY CLOSER! In 2008 Rob was awarded with the “Male Musical Tribute Artist of the Year” award in Las Vegas marking the first (and only) time a Neil Diamond tribute act has won such an honor.

SOLD OUT

View Event →

Neil Diamond The Tribute

Presented by Scorpion Entertainment

Long time Las Vegas performer and Legends in Concert alumni, Rob Garrett, is America’s #1 Neil Diamond tribute artist, and is unparalleled in his portrayal of the legendary performer.

From Vegas to Honolulu, to New York, to Berlin… Rob has come to be known as the ‘King of Diamonds’ as he is able to naturally capture the presence, passion, and energy of this iconic performer in all his youthful ‘jazz singer’ glory. Those who have witnessed Rob’s unparalleled performances will testify that YOU SIMPLY CAN’T GET ANY CLOSER! In 2008 Rob was awarded with the “Male Musical Tribute Artist of the Year” award in Las Vegas marking the first (and only) time a Neil Diamond tribute act has won such an honor.

SOLD OUT

View Event →

Spooky Blues Dance Party Show with The Billy Blues Band

Presented by the Boise Blues Society.

Dress up for the costume contest and bring your dance party shoes! Join Michele, Becky, Joe, Billy and Terry with our newest members Mike Eachus on Keys and Jake Wilson on Sax. Contemporary and blues rock tunes from Janiva Magness, Danielle Nicole, Beth Hart, Etta James, Eric Gales, Eric Clapton, and Kenny Wayne Sheppard, as well as a few Billy Blues Band originals.

View Event →

Idaho Songwriters Association Forum

Sit back and enjoy the show while you listen to local songwriters perform one original song, or step into the spotlight and share a song of your own! This monthly event celebrating 100% original music by local performers takes place on the last Tuesday of every month. The Sapphire Room features a full food and bar menu with table-side service during this event. FREE and open to the public. Seating is first come first served.

View Event →

The Last Call- Sapphire Speakeasy

Step back in time to the roaring '20s at The Sapphire Room for a night of speakeasy style and flair with The Last Call! Dust off your flapper dresses and fedoras, and get ready to revel in the glitz and glamour of the gangster era. Costumes encouraged!

The Last Call is Boise’s premiere classic rock band playing the songs you hold dear to your heart. From Journey to AC/DC, Bob Seger to Tom Petty, John Cougar to Billy Idol. They play them the way you remember them.

View Event →

The Last Call- Halloween Party

Get ready for a spooktacular night at The Sapphire Room with The Last Call's Halloween Party! Join us for a night of classic rock and ghoulish fun. Dress to impress in your most creative, scary, or funny costumes, and dance the night away to the iconic hits of Journey, AC/DC, Bob Seger, Tom Petty, John Cougar, and Billy Idol. Don't miss this thrilling Halloween celebration filled with great music, festive vibes, and spooky surprises!

View Event →

Dark Desert Highway Eagles Tribute

Join us for an unforgettable evening with the Dark Desert Highway Band (DDH). Experience the timeless music of the Eagles, Joe Walsh, and Don Henley as DDH performs classic hits like "Hotel California," "Take It Easy," and "Desperado." Both dance floors will be open for you to dance the night away.

View Event →

Dark Desert Highway Eagles Tribute

Join us for an unforgettable evening with the Dark Desert Highway Band (DDH). Experience the timeless music of the Eagles, Joe Walsh, and Don Henley as DDH performs classic hits like "Hotel California," "Take It Easy," and "Desperado." Both dance floors will be open for you to dance the night away.

View Event →

Emilie-Claire Barlow

Canada's incomparable vocal jazz jewel Emilie-Claire Barlow - leads her stellar band through innovative arrangements of American-Songbook treasures, rhythmic bossa novas and elegant ballads. She continues to endear herself to critics, peers and audiences everywhere with her relaxed, polished demeanour, her charming humour, and a voice of unforgettable beauty. Emilie-Claire’s concert will feature favourites from her extensive repertoire as well as new arrangements from her forthcoming 13th album "Spark Bird”

View Event →

Tejano Outlaw

Tejano Outlaw has been a staple in the Tejano music scene for the past ten years throughout the Pacific Northwest.. In recent years they have been an ambassador for the music spreading the Tejano tex-mex flavor to audiences unfamiliar with sounds of the button accordion and bajo sexto. Get your dancing shoes on as the rhythms of ranchera and cumbia will make your body move!

View Event →

Alice Wallace

"...one of the best singers out there at the moment.." - Saving Country Music

Wallace was named 2017 Female Vocalist of the Year by the California Country Awards and her voice has been called “a powerful natural occurrence… an awe-striking wonder" by Saving Country Music. She previously released four solo albums, the latest of which, 2019’s Into the Blue, earned recognition from Rolling Stone Country with the title track being named one of the Best Americana Songs to Hear Now. This was followed by Lucky Break via Side Pony, a duo project with friend Caitlin Cannon that took the pair across the United States and Europe.

View Event →

The Diego Romero Band

Presented by the Boise Blues Society

Winner of the Best New Blues Band in 2019 from the IEBS, comes an electrifying new band staring Diego Romero. He is bound to keep you at the edge of your seat throughout the night with his explosive guitar work and booming vocals.

View Event →

Flamenco Idaho

Flamenco Idaho is a performing group who draws inspiration from classical guitar, contemporary dance/art performance, cultural music and Flamenco. They are focused on performing new and traditional works that represent the artists that comprise the group. Flamenco Idaho members come from a varying background including classical, cultural and experimental music, numerous dance forms, visual art and poetry. Warm up this winter to the sounds of Flamenco Idaho!

View Event →

Fox & Bones

Scott Gilmore and Sarah Vitort are Fox and Bones—energetic offbeat folksters with a retro-tinged, soul-stirring, modern vintage bent.

Fox and Bones’ fourth album titled "Long Time Honey” is a collaboration with acclaimed songwriter Greg Holden and has received international acclaim for its upbeat and heartfelt songwriting. Naga Mag (Greece) lauded, "The much-loved vocals are so familiar and warm that you feel the love overflowing inside you" and Americana Highways (US) beamed Long Time Honey “should rightly be considered one of the best Americana albums of the year”.

Their hardworking artistic output has earned them first place at the 2023 Tucson Folk Festival songwriting contest and second place in the International Acoustic Music Awards. In between their rigorous tour schedule, the duo founded Portland’s Folk Festival.

View Event →

JUKEBOX

Jukebox is a non-stop, high-energy 8-piece band that ignites the stage as they weave through multi-genre classics from R&B to disco and from country to modern pop.

With soaring vocals, flashy horn lines, and blistering guitar solos, Jukebox puts on an attention-grabbing performance where the dancing starts early and goes all night. Each show includes conga-lines, dance-offs, and sing-alongs that pull in the audience and make them part of the show.

Jukebox isn’t just a performance. It’s an experience.

View Event →

JUKEBOX

Jukebox is a non-stop, high-energy 8-piece band that ignites the stage as they weave through multi-genre classics from R&B to disco and from country to modern pop.

With soaring vocals, flashy horn lines, and blistering guitar solos, Jukebox puts on an attention-grabbing performance where the dancing starts early and goes all night. Each show includes conga-lines, dance-offs, and sing-alongs that pull in the audience and make them part of the show.

Jukebox isn’t just a performance. It’s an experience.

View Event →

The Mystics

"Boise's longest running Classic Rock band!! Let's have some fun!!"

The Mystics are the Boise area’s longest-running classic rock group and the only one still with an original member. The band’s extensive repertoire includes hits from the ’60s by the Beatles, the Rolling Stones, the Byrds, the Everly Brothers, CCR, Buffalo Springfield, Neil Young, the Lovin’ Spoonful and more. And, because audiences are getting younger, newer hits by Tom Petty and the Hearbreakers, the Traveling Wilburys, Bob Dylan, Huey Lewis and the News and others.

View Event →

Mindy Smith

Fans can look forward to hearing new songs from Quiet Town as well as beloved tracks from her previous albums during her live performances.

Mindy’s original songs have been recorded and released by the likes of Alison Krauss, Lee Ann Womack, Faith Hill and most recently Danny Burns ft Sam Bush. Mindy has performed with and toured alongside the likes of Dolly Parton, Emmylou Harris, Alison Krauss, John Prine, Nickel Creek, and Mary Chapin Carpenter. Most recently, Smith was the featured vocalist on Kenny Chesney’s charting single, “Better Boat”. Says Chesney, “if you just close your eyes and listen to her voice -- I’m speaking for me --she brings calm, she brings a sense that it’s all going to be all right. [T]o me, when I hear her voice, it’s like an angel, her voice is so--what’s the word?— ‘genre-less.’ It’s bigger than all of us."

View Event →

Sam Henry Band & Heath Owens Band

A double headliner night of country music featuring the Heath Owens Band & Sam Henry Band

View Event →

Ned Evett - "Strange Kind of Freedom"

Ned Evett is bringing his first vinyl album release party to the Sapphire Room. He will be premiering "Strange Kind of Freedom" in its entirety, featuring his world famous solid glass fretless guitar and backing band.

“The master of the fretless glass-necked guitar ” -USA Today

View Event →

Idaho Songwriters Association Forum

Sit back and enjoy the show while you listen to local songwriters perform one original song, or step into the spotlight and share a song of your own! This monthly event celebrating 100% original music by local performers takes place on the last Tuesday of every month. The Sapphire Room features a full food and bar menu with table-side service during this event. FREE and open to the public. Seating is first come first served.

View Event →

Griffin House

Griffin House is an American singer-songwriter and storyteller. Touring and making records for over 20 years, House has a discography that includes over 13 albums. His debut record “Lost and Found” (2004) was featured on CBS Sunday Morning by music critic and then VP MTV/VH1, Bill Flanagan, who named House one of the best emerging singer-songwriters of our time.

After forging a loyal fan base through years of grassroots touring as an opener for acts such as John Mellencamp and the Cranberries, House broke through as a national headliner in 2009 with an appearance on Late Night with Craig Ferguson and the release of his underground hit “The Guy That Says Goodbye to You is Out of His Mind.”

The music documentary “Rising Star,” released on Amazon Prime in 2019, chronicles House’s journey through the music business, as he attempts to balance the challenges of life as a traveling modern-day troubadour with marriage, fatherhood and sobriety.

LOW TICKET ALERT

View Event →

Glen Phillips - The Waltese Falcon Fund Music Fest

Glen Phillips -During his years as lead singer and main songwriter of Toad the Wet Sprocket, Glen Phillips helped to create the band's elegant folk/pop sound with honest, introspective lyrics that forged a close bond with their fans. When Toad went on hiatus, Glen launched a solo career with his album Abulum, and has stayed busy since, releasing beautifully crafted songs & records

Douglas Cameron w/ John Fricke- Celebrating 30 years of writing songs, Douglas Cameron & John Fricke dive into the back catalogue to play and tell the stories behind the their favorite tunes.

100% of ticket proceeds will be donated tot he Waltese Falcon Fund - A non-profit with the mission of helping pets and their humans with vet bills in emergency situations.

LOW TICKET ALERT

View Event →

The Treasure Valley Jazz All Stars Celebrate Saxophone Greats

Come join the Treasure Valley Jazz All Stars for their second performance at the Sapphire Room! Featuring an “All-Star” line of up of jazz musicians from across the mountain west that will be presenting the music of iconic saxophonists such as Joe Henderson and John Coltrane. The quintet is co-lead by Boise based jazz musicians Derek Ganong (Trumpet) and Alex Sjobeck (Piano). Joining them for this performance is Ben Britton (Tenor Saxophone - Twin Falls, ID), Braun Khan (Bass - Logan, UT), and Brian Claxton (Drums - Denver, CO).

SOLD OUT

View Event →

Idaho Songwriters Association Forum

Sit back and enjoy the show while you listen to local songwriters perform one original song, or step into the spotlight and share a song of your own! This monthly event celebrating 100% original music by local performers takes place on the last Tuesday of every month. The Sapphire Room features a full food and bar menu with table-side service during this event. FREE and open to the public. Seating is first come first served.

View Event →

Stef & The Groove

Stef & The Groove returns with their trademark mix of R&B, Funk, Rock and Contemporary Blues. Stef & The Groove's show is one you won't want to miss!

LOW TICKET ALERT

View Event →

Jimmy Mazz Blast from the Past

Jimmy’s Blast from The Past" '60s & '70s One-Hit Wonders & More is a retro musical review of his favorite memorable hit songs of the '60s and '70s. There will be a hint of the '50s and the '80s thrown in just for fun! You will hear songs everyone knows and loves. These are songs Jimmy grew up on and remembers fondly! The show consists of all major sing along hits, many #1 hits, and a ton of one-hit wonders.

SOLD OUT

View Event →

Brett Reid with Rob Harding: Country Legends

Come join us in the beautiful Sapphire Room as Brett Reid and Rob Harding pay tribute to Country Legends and their music. These tunes, and the stories behind the music, will keep you toe tapping and reminiscing about the "kings of country". Many of these legends are often referred to by a single name: Johnny, Merle, Waylon, Willie, Kris, Garth, and many others.

Brett is a favorite of the Sapphire room and its audiences. His fabulous vocal talent and acoustic guitar playing make for a very special evening of music, stories, and fun. The amazing Rob Harding, another Sapphire favorite, will join Brett on stage with his brilliant guitar skills and smooth harmonies.

SOLD OUT

View Event →

Órale and Sturdy Souls: JOYFUL

100% of the Sapphire Room Fundraising Concert ticket and live auction revenue will go to WCA (The Women’s and Children’s Alliance). Learn more about the WCA

Sturdy Souls: The magic of family harmonies is undeniable, and Sturdy Souls will leave you spellbound with their captivating sound. Sharing an unrivaled 4-part harmony experience, the Sturdy Souls share favorites that span the spectrum of music, from contemporary folk hits to timeless classics from the 60s and 70s. VIDEO

Órale: A soul-stirring fusion of Latin, Motown, and Soul. At the core of this energetic 7-piece ensemble is the electrifying Koki Gonzalez, a virtuoso lead vocalist known for his soulful tones and magnetic stage presence. His stirring interpretations breathe new life into classic hits and original compositions alike. Backing Koki is a versatile 7-piece Motown, Soul, and Latin groove-oriented dance band, each member a skilled musician in their own right.

View Event →

Silverbacks

Presented by the Boise Blues Society.

The SILVERBACKS of Boise is an energetic Blues/Rock band that performs a wide variety of Chicago, British, and West Coast Blues, as well as their own compositions and other fun dance music. From Stevie Ray to John Mayall, Van Morrison to Sonnyboy Williamson, you'll hear it all.

The SILVERBACKS feature two lead guitarists, David Moss and Mike Trail, bassist Don Cunningham, and consummate drummer Lawson Hill. Robert Sutherland provides tasty keyboards, and the band will be featuring some surprise guest artists to spice things up!

View Event →

Operatini: Idaho’s Best

Come enjoy an evening of music, food, and drinks! The ticket price includes dinner plus some of Opera Idaho’s talented singers performing some of their favorite musical theatre and opera selections.

Dinner Buffet: Basil Chicken Caprese, Sour Cream and Rosemary Mashed Potatoes, Chef’s Choice Seasonal Vegetable, Mixed Greens with Assorted Dressings, Assorted Rolls with Butter, Assorted Cheesecakes.

LOW TICKET ALERT

View Event →

Dancehall Days- An Evening of Yacht Rock

An Evening of Yacht Rock! Let the classics like "Just The Two of Us" by Grover Washington Jr., "Wonderful Tonight" by Eric Clapton, and "More Than A Woman" by Bee Gees transport you to the sun-kissed shores of nostalgia. You’ll groove to timeless hits from artists like Eagles, Hall & Oates, and Steely Dan while you sip on your favorite Sapphire Room cocktail.

SOLD OUT

View Event →

Dancehall Days- An Evening of Fleetwood Mac

Dancehall Days has been performing their "Evening of Fleetwood Mac" regularly since its debut in 2017 at Fleetwood's on Front Street, Maui. You'll be singing along to Rhiannon, Dreams, Go Your Own Way, Everywhere, and many more!

Astonishing musicianship with a repertoire that is wildly diverse and authentic. Dancehall Days has been thrilling audiences all over the continental United States and Hawaii, England and the Bahamas, playing at venues such as Fleetwood's On Front Street - Maui, Charley’s - Maui, The Troubadour - London, One And Only Ocean Club - Nassau, San Francisco Ritz Carlton, Austin City Limits and The Old Joint Stock Theatre - Birmingham

SOLD OUT

View Event →

Steve Eaton - Hey Mr. Dreamer

Musician and singer-songwriter Steve Eaton is an Idaho gem—a Governor’s Award recipient for his contribution to the Idaho arts, a favorite to music fans across the state, and the coolest dude in the room.

Steve has written songs for Art Garfunkel, The Carpenters, The Righteous Brothers, Glen Campbell, and Anne Murray.

View Event →

The Fabulous Chancellors

Beginning in 1959, The Fabulous Chancellors have enjoyed 65 years of recognition as a classic rock 'n' roll show and dance band. With nearly thirty original recorded songs on six completed album collections, The Fabulous Chancellors have also distinguished themselves on record, two of which, "Diamond in the Sky" and "Hey Girl," achieved substantial national airplay and popularity in the early 60's. Two 1990 recordings, "(Me and My Baby Like) Old Songs" and tongue-in-cheek "I'm Cool" subsequently achieved widespread airplay across the nation on select radio stations.

LOW TICKET ALERT

View Event →

Jonathan Warren & The Billy Goats

“Like a wandering mysterious traveler, Jonathan Warren & The Billy Goats don’t quite belong in country, or folk, nor alternative, yet they spend their days smoothly passing through each, leaving an identifiable and memorable fusion of all. Raggedly soothing dual vocals, violin, banjo, mandolin, upright bass and heavy dose of swagger make up the Progressive PsychoBilly Folk Grass that is the Boise band.” -Greg Nanobot Rock Reviews

View Event →

Rob Verdi Returns With Special Guests

How jazz influences pop, rock and R&B- Presented by the IJEE

Joining Rob will be 3 special vocalists: Jake Stigers, Emily Stanton & Shirley VanPaepeghem and a 7 piece band including our fabulous IJEE horn section.

Rob will be bringing several of his amazing arrangements as well as several we have had commissioned especially for this concert.

You’ll be hearing music from Steely Dan, Al Jarreau, Stevie Wonder, Chuck Mangione, Larry Carlton, Spyro Gyra, and Average White Band. Some of the styles of jazz you’ll hear will include smooth, cool and fusion.

SOLD OUT

View Event →

Smoke on the Water III

The Sapphire Room is proud to present Smoke on the Water featuring: 11 Time Grammy Winner and lead singer for Santana Tony Lindsay , Myron Dove (Bassist for Santana/ Robben Ford/Montrose/John Lee Hooker/Gatemouth Brown), Walfredo Reyes Jr. (Drummer for Chicago/Santana/Steve Winwood/Lindsay Buckingham/David Lindsey El Rayo X), Eamonn Flynn (Keys-The Commitments/Michael Franti & Spearhead) and Gary Tackett (Guitar-Billy Currington/Merle Haggard)

These world class musicians played together 20 years ago and are reuniting in Boise for this major music event. There will be Smoke On The Water!

Tejano Outlaw

Tejano Outlaw has been a staple in the Tejano music scene for the past ten years throughout the Pacific Northwest.. In recent years they have been an ambassador for the music spreading the Tejano tex-mex flavor to audiences unfamiliar with sounds of the button accordion and bajo sexto. Get your dancing shoes on as the rhythms of ranchera and cumbia will make your body move!

Tylor & The Train Robbers

Boise based band Tylor & the Train Robbers, comprised of Tylor Ketchum, his brothers Jason and Tommy Bushman, and Rider Soran deliver a perfect, lyric-driven blend of Roots Country and modern Americana music. Paired with their unrelenting dedication to the road, they have earned the reputation of hardworking professionals whose live shows highlight the connectedness that they’ve acquired not only from years of playing together, but also from the family bond that they all share.

The Junebugs

Imagine if Neil Young and Janis Joplin had three love children, and those children grew up to like folk rock and hip hop. The Junebugs combine high-energy pop and rock with Pacific Northwest folksy goodness to create a genre-bending sound you can kick up your heels to.

The Junebugs originated on the Vancouver, BC circuit before moving back home to Portland, OR. There, guitarist Barrett picked up drummer Kyle Owen and bassist Nathaniel Daniel, to round out the dynamic trio. Covering everything from Tom Petty to TLC to Lorde, the eclectic taste of the trio ranges from turn-of-the-century Americana to modern Hip Hop, with a strong emphasis on vocal harmony. Their original tunes have a dreamy, sweet quality reminiscent of Neil Young and Iron & Wine, peppered with fiery banjo lines. There is something for everyone here.

Idaho Songwriters Association Forum

Sit back and enjoy the show while you listen to local songwriters perform one original song, or step into the spotlight and share a song of your own! This monthly event celebrating 100% original music by local performers takes place on the last Tuesday of every month. The Sapphire Room features a full food and bar menu with table-side service during this event. FREE and open to the public. Seating is first come first served.

Comedy Night with Cam Bertrand

Join us for an evening of all-ages welcomed comedy with Cam Bertrand. Cam is best known for his camthecomic TikTok account, his time on America’s Got Talent, and his Dry Bar Special, Sophisticated Ignorance.

The Key Queens will be opening the show from 7-7:45. The Key Queens are the region’s only all-ladies dueling piano show. Lisa and Amy are Idaho natives who honed their skills while working at the world famous Pat O’Brien’s Piano Bar in New Orleans…the birthplace of dueling pianos.

Sam Outlaw

LA Weekly calls Sam Outlaw "a legitimate contender to be the biggest country star LA has produced since Dwight Yoakam," and his new single is immediately recognizable as Sam's own proprietary brand of "So Cal Country."

Sam has toured the world extensively as a headlining artist and at marquee festivals such as Stagecoach and Hardly Strictly Bluegrass. Sam has also toured in support of beloved songwriters such as John Prine, Kacey Musgraves, Dwight Yoakam, Margo Price, and Shania Twain.

“(Sam’s music) is polished and Southern Californian in its sensibility. But Outlaw’s sense of humor gives his work an edge." - The New Yorker

Ímar

There are many reasons to be excited about new Glasgow-based five-piece Ímar – not least a line-up featuring current and former members of Mànran, RURA, Talisk, Barrule and Cara whose collectively crammed trophy-cabinet includes the 2018 BBC Radio 2 Musician of the Year, 2016 Radio Scotland Musician of the Year, BBC Radio 2 Horizon Award, BBC Radio 2 Young Folk Award and several All-Britain & All-Ireland titles. By far the best and biggest reason, however, is how excited the band are themselves.

“As soon as we all sat down to play together properly, it just worked,” says bodhrán player Adam Brown (RURA), originally from Suffolk. “We were a bit stunned, to be honest; all looking round at everyone else, thinking, ‘Is it just me, or was that really good?’”
